title: A Novel Haptic Device for Impact Force and Extension
title_en: A Novel Haptic Device for Impact Force and Extension
abstract: 本研究は触覚インタフェース向けに衝撃力と伸長を再現し制御するための新しい触覚デバイスを提案している。提案手法は発光素子を用いたセンサ兼駆動構成とPC制御を組み合わせ、複数の発光素子配置による検出と提示で衝撃と伸長を扱う設計を示している。
abstract_en: This study proposes a new haptic device to reproduce and control impact force and extension for haptic interfaces. The proposed approach combines light-emitting elements as sensor/actuator components with PC control and uses multiple emitter arrangements to detect and present impact and extension.
positioning_summary: 本研究は触覚提示における衝撃力と伸長の提示・計測のギャップを埋めることを位置づけとしている。提案研究は触覚システムや遠隔操作などの利用者に影響する衝撃力と伸長に関する問題を対象としている。
positioning_summary_en: This study positions itself to fill the gap in presenting and measuring impact force and extension in haptic rendering. This study targets issues of impact force and extension that affect users in haptic systems and teleoperation.
purpose_summary: 本研究の目的は触覚提示分野で衝撃力と伸長を再現し制御できる装置を提案することである。提案の目的は衝撃力と伸長が重要となる触覚システムや遠隔操作向けに提示と計測の手段を提供することである。
purpose_summary_en: The purpose of this study is to propose a device capable of reproducing and controlling impact force and extension in haptic rendering. The purpose of this study is to provide presentation and measurement means for impact force and extension relevant to haptic systems and teleoperation.
method_summary: 本研究は発光素子を用いたセンサ兼駆動構成とPC制御を組み合わせた新しい触覚デバイス設計を提案している。提案研究は複数の発光素子の配置による検出・提示方式で衝撃力と伸長を扱うメカニズムを実装し、その制御をPCで行う構成を示している。
method_summary_en: This study proposes a new haptic device design that combines light-emitting elements as sensor/actuator components with PC control. This study implements a mechanism that handles impact force and extension by using multiple emitter arrangements for detection and presentation and controls that mechanism via a PC.

Emerging interfaces is broader; paper targets concrete haptic device implementation.
Sensors/actuators under embedded systems less directly relevant than hardware sensors path chosen.

prompt.system: You are an expert indexer who assigns ACM CCS 2012 concepts to computing research papers. You will receive the paper's title, abstract, and structured summaries. Use only the provided candidate concepts. Select at most 3 concepts that best describe the paper. If none of the candidates fit, return an empty list.
prompt.user:
Year: 2010

Paper summary:
Title: A Novel Haptic Device for Impact Force and Extension
Authors: Tsubasa Imaoka, Makoto Okabe, Rikio Onai
Year: 2010
Abstract: This study proposes a new haptic device to reproduce and control impact force and extension for haptic interfaces. The proposed approach combines light-emitting elements as sensor/actuator components with PC control and uses multiple emitter arrangements to detect and present impact and extension.
Positioning Summary: This study positions itself to fill the gap in presenting and measuring impact force and extension in haptic rendering. This study targets issues of impact force and extension that affect users in haptic systems and teleoperation.
Purpose Summary: The purpose of this study is to propose a device capable of reproducing and controlling impact force and extension in haptic rendering. The purpose of this study is to provide presentation and measurement means for impact force and extension relevant to haptic systems and teleoperation.
Method Summary: This study proposes a new haptic device design that combines light-emitting elements as sensor/actuator components with PC control. This study implements a mechanism that handles impact force and extension by using multiple emitter arrangements for detection and presentation and controls that mechanism via a PC.

Respond with JSON using the following schema:
{
  "ccs": [
    {
      "id": "concept id string",
      "path": "concept path string",
      "confidence": "high|medium|low",
      "justification": "brief reason citing evidence from the paper summary"
    }
  ],
  "rejected": [
    {
      "id": "concept id string",
      "reason": "why it was excluded"
    }
  ]
}
Always use candidate IDs exactly as provided. Do not invent new concepts. Limit the array under "ccs" to at most 3 entries. Limit the array under "rejected" to at most 5 entries. Keep every justification or reason concise (no more than 120 characters).
